data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Added enclave check in `_setup_security` (#8)

This commit introduces a check in
`ros2launch_security.node_action.security.SecurityNodeActionExtension._setup_security`
that ensures an enclave does not already exist before
creating it. This is necessary because:

1. It is entirely possible that an enclave was created prior
to a `ros2 launch [...] --secure` run.
2. Without checking for a pre-existing run, the
`sros2.keystore._enclave.create_enclave` method overwrites any specific
`permissions.xml` file with wildcarded permissions, which does not work
well when integrating with tools like `nodl_to_policy` and `ros2
security create_permissions`, which may have been used earlier either
programmatically or through the CLI to generate desired access
permission XML files.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Integration test with `nodl_to_policy` and middleware-specific XML permissions files (#9)

* Introducing test dependencies on nodl/policy packages

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Generating explicit permissions for each NoDL description in the package

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Adding new launch test to CMakeLists.txt

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Adding end-to-end test using `nodl_to_policy`

This commit fixes the launch test where a secure launch
description is created, in which permission artifacts
are generated using the converted policies provided by
`nodl_to_policy` package.

Broadly, it serves as a bigger example for integration of
`nodl_to_policy`.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Add documentation to nodl_to_policy test script

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Michel Hidalgo
data.message:
Fix failing tests

- Target sros2.keystore._keystore, not sros2.api._keystore
- Target nodl module, not launch_ros.actions.node.nodl
- Patch nodl.get_node_by_executable() properly
- Lookup enclave in Node.cmd attribute
- Add demo_nodes_py as test dependency

Signed-off-by: Michel Hidalgo <michel@ekumenlabs.com>
